tile.title: How do I create a new session?
tile.comment: Click here to be directed to an interactive demo showing you the steps to create a new session.

accordion.title: How do I create a new session?
accordion.htmlContent: To start the interactive demo, simply press the "Start interactive demo" button below and follow the red circle which will indicate where to click and give you additional information.

tutorialData.slideText: Start by creating a new session
Let's select Service Provider, and enter our URL
Add a name and select test cases by ticking the corresponding box
Select test cases by ticking the corresponding box
Select test cases by ticking the corresponding box
Press Next when you are finished
Configure your System Under Test using this data and press Confirm
Your session has now been created and the test cases can be accessed on the left. Click "Reset Demo" to start the demo again

tile.title: How do I execute a session as a Mobile Money API Provider?
tile.comment: Click here to learn more about how you can execute test cases as a Mobile Money API Provider.

accordion.title: How do I execute a session as a Mobile Money API Provider?
accordion.htmlContent: To start the interactive demo, simply press the "Start interactive demo" button below and follow the red circle which will indicate where to click and give you additional information.

tutorialData.slideText: First, select the session you would like to execute
The left panel shows all selected test cases, along with information on previous runs. Select the one you would like to test
This page details the use case and displays test runs. You can also view the use case flow and example test data. Click here to view the flow for this test.
Configuration settings are shown here. Make sure your system is properly set-up to send requests using these URLs
In this test case we can see the API client performs the first request. Click "Run Test Case" to start the test run
Here we can view all the details about the test run for each individual step. Clicking on a performed test will bring up the expected and actual results
You can also see the request and response data and validation for each step of the use case flow. To start the demo again press "Reset Demo"

tile.title: Learn more about the GSMA Mobile Money API

accordion.title: Learn more about the GSMA Mobile Money API
accordion.htmlContent:
To learn more about the GSMA Mobile Money API, you can follow the links below:

  • GSMA Mobile Money API website
  • GSMA Mobile Money API developer portal

tile.title: GSMA Mobile Money API Response Codes and Business Rules
tile.comment: Click here to learn more about GSMA Mobile Money API Response Codes and Business Rules before you complete the use case questionnaire

accordion.title: GSMA Mobile Money API Response Codes and Business Rules
accordion.htmlContent:
Introduction

Mobile Money Operators and Technology Platform Providers who provide Mobile Money APIs should maximise their adherence to the GSMA Mobile Money API Specification business rules ensure that their platform APIs are as consistently accessible as possible by the mobile money ecosystem.

As part of the quality assessment of providers who are seeking compliance with the GSMA Mobile Money API Compliance Verification Service and obtaining the compliant mark to demonstrate compliance to the API Specification, the GSMA requests adherence to the GSMA Mobile Money API Response Codes and Business Rules which outlines expected API behaviour for APIs and API state and exception handling in a harmonised manner.

GSMA Mobile Money API Return Codes Harmonisation

The GSMA Mobile Money API Specification manages API state and exception handling in the harmonised manner described below. For more details, see the API specification.

Harmonised API State Model and HTTP codes

Synchronous requests should be handled using Standardised HTTP Response Codes

Asynchronous requests should be handled using an intermediate RequestState Object which can return an object reference or Error Object.

Asynchronous Callback responses can return an object reference or Error Object.

Harmonised Return Codes

Standardised return codes are returned for all successful requests permitted by the API specification.

Request Type Caller Supported HTTP Method Flow Response Code
Synchronous Client GET SuccessfulObject Response 200
Asynchronous Client POST SuccessfulRequestState Response 202
Asynchronous Client PATCH SuccessfulRequestState Response 202
Asynchronous Provider PUT SuccessfulObject Response 204

Harmonised Error Codes

Standardised error codes are returned in the Error Object for all errors returned by the permitted requests above. To ensure industry wide harmonisation across mobile money platform APIs, please use the following business rules for harmonised error objects.

If a platform specific error is NOT defined, it is permitted to use the generic error codes described.

Error Category HTTP code Error Description (OPTIONAL) Error Code
Authentication 401 General Client Authentication failure. No further details provided to prevent leakage of security information. ClientAuthorisationError
Authentication 401 The debit party did not approve the request. RequestDeclined
Authentication 401 The party requesting the service has not provided the right credentials and/or does not have permission to perform this service. RequestingPartyAuthorisationError
Identification 404 The requested resource could not be matched on the system with the supplied identifier(s). IdentifierError
Validation 400 The specified property contents are greater than the maximum allowed length or less than the minimum allowed length. LengthError
Validation 400 The specified property contents do not conform to the format required for this Property. FormatError
Validation 400 The amount supplied is negative and this is not allowed for the given service. NegativeValue
Validation 400 The currency supplied is not supported by the API Provider. CurrencyNotSupported
Validation 400 A mandatory value has not been provided in the header and/or JSON body. MandatoryValueNotSupplied
Validation 400 A generic Error Code for the Validation Error Category. This is used in where the API Provider has generated an error that does not map to existing Validation error codes. GenericError
Business Rule 400 The party has exceeded their daily transacting volume limit - This can be a service limit or a limit that is specific to the party. DailyVolumeLimitExceeded
Business Rule 400 The party has exceeded their daily transacting value limit - This can be a service limit or a limit that is specific to the party. DailyValueLimitExceeded
Business Rule 400 The party has exceeded their weekly transacting volume limit - This can be a service limit or a limit that is specific to the party. WeeklyVolumeLimitExceeded
Business Rule 400 The party has exceeded their weekly transacting value limit - This can be a service limit or a limit that is specific to the party. WeeklyValueLimitExceeded
Business Rule 400 The party has exceeded their monthly transacting volume limit - This can be a service limit or a limit that is specific to the party. MonthlyVolumeLimitExceeded
Business Rule 400 The party has exceeded their monthly transacting value limit - This can be a service limit or a limit that is specific to the party. MonthlyValueLimitExceeded
Business Rule 400 The party has exceeded their cumulative transacting value limit defined for the account. AccountMaxTotalValueExceeded
Business Rule 400 The party has exceeded their cumulative transacting volume limit defined for the account. AccountMaxTotalVolumeExceeded
Business Rule 400 The amount specified for the transaction is less than the defined minimum for the service. LessThanTransactionMinValue
Business Rule 400 The amount specified for the transaction is greater than the defined maximum for the service. GreaterThanTransactionMaxValue
Business Rule 400 The amount specified will cause the balance of the credit parties account to exceed the rule limit. MaxBalanceExceeded
Business Rule 400 The debit and credit parties are the same. SamePartiesError
Business Rule 400 The request has previously been processed, i.e. this request is a duplicate and hence has been rejected. DuplicateRequest
Business Rule 400 Available funds are not sufficient to enable the party to be debited for the requested transaction. InsufficientFunds
Business Rule 400 The account is in a state that does not permit the requested service. IncorrectState
Business Rule 400 The requested amount is less than the amount that needs to be supplied for this transaction UnderPaymentNotAllowed
Business Rule 400 The requested amount is greater than the amount that needs to be supplied for this transaction OverPaymentNotAllowed
Business Rule 400 The client has submitted too many requests within a period of time. RateLimitError
Business Rule 400 The party has exceeded their daily transacting volume limit - This can be a service limit or a limit that is specific to the party. DailyVolumeLimitExceeded
Business Rule 400 The party has exceeded their daily transacting value limit - This can be a service limit or a limit that is specific to the party. DailyValueLimitExceeded
Business Rule 400 The party has exceeded their weekly transacting volume limit - This can be a service limit or a limit that is specific to the party. WeeklyVolumeLimitExceeded
Business Rule 400 The party has exceeded their weekly transacting value limit - This can be a service limit or a limit that is specific to the party. WeeklyValueLimitExceeded
Business Rule 400 The party has exceeded their monthly transacting volume limit - This can be a service limit or a limit that is specific to the party. MonthlyVolumeLimitExceeded
Business Rule 400 The party has exceeded their monthly transacting value limit - This can be a service limit or a limit that is specific to the party. MonthlyValueLimitExceeded
Business Rule 400 The party has exceeded their cumulative transacting value limit defined for the account. AccountMaxTotalValueExceeded
Business Rule 400 The party has exceeded their cumulative transacting volume limit defined for the account. AccountMaxTotalVolumeExceeded
Business Rule 400 A generic Error Code which should only be used if the API Provider has generated an error that does not map to existing Rule error codes or the API Provider wishes to avoid disclosure of confidential information regarding the resource or parties to the resource. GenericError

GSMA Mobile Money API Business Rules

Account Balances API

This API defines specific properties for returning balances associated with an account

Method and Path

GET /accounts/{identifierType}/{identifier}/balance

Minimum compliance

Property Type Description Validation
currentBalance string

The current outstanding balance on the account

Note the current balance comprises all funds which are included on the balance of the account including unavailable funds, reserved funds and uncleared funds.

 Amount Validation

Transactions API

This API defines specific properties for returning balances associated with an account

Method and Path

POST /transactions/type/{transactiontype}

Compliance rules

Property Type Description Validation
debitParty array A collection of key/value pairs that enable the debit party to be identified. Keys include MSISDN and Wallet Identifier

For Payee-Initiated Merchant Payments Mandatory

For Payer-Initiated Merchant Payments Optional (platform can infer via Client)
creditParty array A collection of key/value pairs that enable the debit party to be identified. Keys include MSISDN and Wallet Identifier

For Payer-Initiated Merchant Payments Mandatory

For Payee-Initiated Merchant Payments Optional (platform can infer via Client)

Note for any type of transaction request, at least one of debitParty and creditParty must be supplied and both can be supplied. If one of the optional parties is not supplied by the request, it will be updated by the platform before the transaction object is returned to the client.

tile.title: GSMA Mobile Money API Security
tile.comment: Click here to learn more about the GSMA Mobile Money API Security before you complete the security questionnaire.

accordion.title: GSMA Mobile Money API Security
accordion.htmlContent:
Introduction

Mobile Money Operators and Technology Platform Providers who provide Mobile Money APIs used for delivering financial services to customers have a responsibility to secure customer information and services.

As part of the quality assessment of providers who are seeking compliance with the GSMA Mobile Money API Compliance Verification Service and obtaining the compliant mark to demonstrate compliance to the API Specification, the GSMA requests completion of the security questionnaire below. The questionnaire enables submission of a brief self-assessment by providers on their baseline security recommendations encompassing two main areas.

  • API provider operational security, based on common industry guidance for baseline security for mobile operators and payment providers, provided by global industry bodies such as the GSMA and the PCI SSC.
  • Technical API security for API gateway to API client connections and authenticating end users, based on the GSMA Mobile Money API Security Design and Implementation Guidelines, provided by the GSMA.

Reference Guidelines

API Provider Operational Security

Several global industry bodies provide common industry guidance for baseline security for organisations who provide connectivity and services, especially financial services, to customers. Any organisations providing APIs which store or transmit customer data have a responsibility to ensure the security of their operations. For example, guidance on baseline operational security has been provided by organisations such as the GSMA and the PCI SSC.

GSMA Mobile Money Certification

The GSMA provides GSMA Mobile Money Certification to Mobile Money Providers to promote excellence in the provision of mobile money services. It is based on independent assessments of a providerâ€™s ability to deliver secure and reliable services, and are measured against global industry best practice.

GSMA Mobile Money Certification

GSMA Baseline Security Controls

The GSMA provides self-assessment guidelines on baseline security controls for the global industry of Mobile Network Operators to facilitate understanding and development of their security posture to a foundation level in order to protect the global mobile ecosystem.

GSMA Baseline Security Controls

PCI Data Security Standard

The PCI Security Standards Council provides standards for global payment account data security, in particular PCI DSS was developed to encourage and enhance cardholder data security and facilitate the broad adoption of consistent data security measures globally. PCI DSS provides a baseline of technical and operational requirements designed to protect account data, and applies to all entities involved in payments processing which store, process or transmit cardholder or authentication data.

PCI Data Security Standard

Technical API Security

GSMA Mobile Money API Security Design and Implementation Guidelines

Alongside the GSMA Mobile Money API specification definitions which standardise the connection between API Clients and Mobile Money platforms, the GSMA have published complementary Security Design and Implementation Guidelines which provide best practice guidance for the following two aspects of providing open APIs.

  • Security measures and best practices applicable to the connection between the API Client and the API Gateway.
  • Security measures and best practices applicable to authenticating end users to the Mobile Money platform.

GSMA Mobile Money API Security Design and Implementation Guidelines

tile.title: GSMA Mobile Money API Security Questionnaire
tile.comment: Click here to complete the GSMA Mobile Money API Security Self-Assessment Questionnaire

accordion.title: GSMA Mobile Money API Security Questionnaire
